dialogue.text: Only a handful of girls wind up coming to the next competition, but it’s not because none of them want to.
Yasu’s insistence that only a small group follow her to the church led to the sudden fragmentation of our class- like it’s no more than some undisclosed ingredient on an ethereal cutting board.
Each press of the knife slices away not only our bodies, but what those bodies lie on.
And before we know it, the fragments spread out, forever being stripped of the only opportunity they’ll ever have to be attached to anything.
I’m not saying that’s what will happen tonight. Doing so would be a bit overdramatic.
But that doesn’t stop me from thinking about what would happen if it did.
And which pieces I would reach for first if they all started falling away at once.
Rin. Sana. Otoha. Touka. Imani.

At the behest of Yasu, this is all that remains of our once spectacular group as the rest is off celebrating and thinking about me. Celebrating while thinking about me. Thinking ABOUT ME while CELEBRATING.
I learned a long time ago that one of the most effective methods to make yourself feel more human is to always put yourself first.
If you can’t find yourself, just latch onto whatever is closest.
And in this case, the closest thing I can find to the way I feel is a handful of semi-intangible thoughts, slipping through my fingers like long, red hair with bits of scalp still attached.
If I squint my eyes, I can forget what they are.
I can make them look more like threads.
{b}THIS IS THE WRONG SKY.{/b}
Stop.
What? Why? Is there, like...mass going on or something?
In fact, why are we even here in the first place? Couldn’t we have just done this trivia thing at Sana’s bar or whatever?
Yasu was adamant that the contest would have to be here for her to have any sort of chance against Rin. And Rin agreed to the terms as she already had a sizable handicap.
Is that what happened? Because I’ve started just saying whatever it is that I think will make Yasu go away the fastest and I don’t even know what I’m agreeing to half the time.
I...should try that strategy sometime...
Just let us in and we can be quiet until mass is over or something. Being...wherever the Hell we are right now is giving me the creeps.
{i}Where you are{/i} is the front porch of salvation...a place that you would not be able to see at all if it were not for two and a half of us.
Uhh...what?
If that’s...a short-joke...I’m going to be sad...
You have any idea what’s going on right now, Senpai?
I never have any idea what’s going on when I come here.
You a regular? Didn’t take you as the religious type.
I’m not. I probably just come here because I’m worried that Yasu’s going to hurt herself or something.
Probably?
It’s complicated.
Well, whatever it is, I can’t say I feel comfortable over here. In fact, if it was anybody other than Yasu leading all of us to this place, I’d probably be fearing for my life right about now.
I have no idea how it being Yasu makes you {i}more{/i} comfortable about that, but you do you.
Yasu’s not out to hurt anybody, I don’t think. She clearly believes all of this crap, yeah- but false beliefs are totally common in people who aren’t exactly, uhh...the same as the rest of us.
What if her god told her to kill us? Since she’s such a fanatic...she’d have to oblige, right?
Oh, come on, man! You have any idea how long it’s been since I’ve practiced Krav Maga? I ain’t ready to fight for my life tonight! I just wanted to judge a contest!
No one will be judging anything.
It is He and He alone who bestows judgement on all there is to be judged. And stepping into His sanctum just to tread all over His toes is not welcome.
Wait...you’re not forfeiting, are you?
All I am doing is protecting that which I have been ordained to protect. The contest will proceed as normal within the walls of the holy.
But only four of us will enter while the rest of you remain out here.
But why-
Because you are not ready.
His is a church that welcomes all, but only after certain conditions have been met. It is only then that one is chosen.
I’m confused. I thought {i}I{/i} was the only one who was chosen. Now two more people have been chosen as well?
You do not understand the choices being {i}made.{/i}
Well, you’ve certainly got that much right.
Who are the four, Yasu? I assume that you, Sensei, and Rin are among the three....But which of us apart from that is the fourth?
She with the silly, green helmet.
Why Sana? What do the rest of us need to do to...fulfill your god’s conditions or whatever?
All that you can do is unintentional. There is no single method that will allow you inside of the sanctuary.
My feet will allow me inside of the sanctuary a lot better than weird religious riddles will, I’ll tell you that much.

Yasu, please explain this in a more concrete way so that those of us remaining outside do not become disheartened. I’m sure you must understand this comes as a bit of a shock to us after the long ride here.
I...will swap with Otoha and...stay out here...if that’s okay...
It is not. He wants you to observe...to peer into His splendor with your brand new eyes and throw yourself deeper into a life full of patience and understanding.
And unfortunately there is no “concrete way” of explaining this as the rumbling of the surface has already formed far too many cracks on these hallowed grounds.
Every crack you step on will be met with tragedy. And it is only I who can properly guide those who have been selected to-
Oh, fucking whatever. Just go in there and get this shit over with if you’re not going to let us in.

Hey, I...know I may have {i}accidentally{/i} agreed to this to give you a fair shot, but...is there any way I can give you a fair shot {i}outside{/i} of a mega creepy church that I can't bring my girlfriend into?
No...
You waited too long to ask.
By now, His tendrils are already wrapped around your legs.
It is only a matter of time until you’re pulled in.
Alas...it is now {i}you{/i} who does not have a {i}fair shot...{/i}
But...
At least you will learn how misguided...how {i}small{/i} you truly are...
Reluctantly and hesitantly, those of us who have been chosen (Which apparently has multiple meanings now) follow Yasu through the church doors.
There are no tables or tea cups...bunnies or blindfolds...just the same sets of stone pews I have familiarized myself with in a place where nothing should ever be familiar at all.
Wow...
It looks...a lot bigger on the inside...
Is it just me, or...is it kind of hard to breathe in here?
Blessed be those who enter the church...Who walk through His heart...Partake in His search...
Blessed be those who now have been found...Who don’t know they need saving...Who can’t hear the sounds...
We are with you, My Lord. Peer into us so that we may peer into you and blind ourselves with the light of all that you have done.
I have brought these girls here today with the full intention of giving them wings...though, how long it will take, I am not sure.
The light of the one who has seen you will one day flow through them. And when that time comes, we will return here under a different pretense.
Under a different sky.
But today, all I wish is for them to see your glory. All I wish is for them to see how wonderful you are and how expansive the world is once you close your eyes.
I do not {i}ask{/i} this of you, God- for I know that it is not within my right nor my power to ask for anything.
But I trust that you will show them through me. And that they will understand they, too, are just vessels beneath the layers of flesh and muscle and bone.
I understand that everything hurts, God.
But I pray that the pain of this realization will not be too great for them to bear.
I really don’t like this, Sensei. You know that feeling you get when you, like...sneak into school at night? Or go into some creepy basement? The one where your stomach is all like “GUHHHHH?”
Not really.
Well, that’s how I feel right now.
Then forfeit before this contest thing kicks off and we can all go home. I don’t really like this place either.
Are you kidding? This is the perfect chance to show you that the...growing distance between us we talked about the other day is all just surface level stuff!
We’re still friends, right?! We still know a bunch of stuff about each other, right?!
We’re not growing apart at all! I’ll show you!
Rin-
I mean it! I miss you and I’m sorry that things are getting all weird between us and...also, that I’m getting randomly emotional right now for some reason?
Um...
I...I don’t know what’s going on! I just have to prove to everyone that we’re still homies no matter what mistakes we make or...what things we accidentally reveal to other people!
Rin...I...
What did you-
Nothing! I’m sorry! I love you! But, like...friend love! Okay?
Rin, I...think we should start the contest now. I’m also...starting to feel a little...weird in here...
It’s not like it’s...harder to breathe, though...it’s more like...uhh...
Actually, let’s just...uhh...
I think I...have to sit down...
Sana darts past Rin and me before taking a seat on a pew and slapping her cheeks a few times to shake off whatever it is she was feeling moments ago.
And while I’m not sure if it actually {i}works{/i} or not, I elect to assume it does once she pulls her phone from the waistband of her skirt and begins to search for something...
Um...so...we had Ami come up with all of the questions for the Sensei...knowledge test...thing, since...she’s the one who’s known him the longest.
True...but I can’t see how that’ll help when I barely know anything about myself that {i}I{/i} wasn’t here to figure out firsthand.
If there are any questions about anything prior to my start in Kumon-mi, I won’t be able to determine who’s right or not. And without Ami here, I can’t see how we could even-
Wait. No. Why would there be any questions about things from before Rin and I even knew one another? If Ami knows anything about me, she should know I don’t open up about things like that.
So...these should all be fairly straightforward questions, shouldn’t they?
A strange feeling catches up to me as well.
It doesn’t involve breathing.
But it does make it harder to breathe.
I think...umm...the easiest thing to do would be...to have you two take turns answering...
And if both of you have the same answer...we can just...move on to the next question.
Whoever gets...ten correct answers first...will be crowned the winner...
Is...Is that okay?
Yes.
Rin?
Huh? Oh! Yeah. Yeah, that’s fine.
Then...I guess we’ll have you go first since...I’m suddenly the one in charge of this contest...
We can start off with something that...looks easy...
Oh. This one works...
How old is Sensei?
31. Easy. Next question.
Wait...you have to give Yasu a chance to answer...
Yasu...same question...
How old is Sensei?
Yasu?...
I’m sorry...there seems to be...some sort of problem.
There is an answer in my head...but there is no way it can be accurate. That wouldn’t make sense.
Do you...want to guess anyway?...
Ya-
No.
No...I will not answer this question. It is most assuredly some sort of mistake.
Is having so many people inside of the church the cause of some sort of disturbance in-
Okay, next question! Let’s keep this shit going so we can get out of here.
Um...who does...Sensei love more than anyone in the world?...
Am I guessing the answer Ami wrote? Or the actual answer?
Probably...the actual answer...but they might be the same, so...
Sexual love? Or {i}love{/i} love?
I...really hope it means {i}love{/i} love...otherwise...
That was a trick question. Sensei doesn’t believe in {i}love{/i} love. Which means that it defaults to sexual love, which makes the answer...
Uta-chan!
Correct.
Is it?...
I had a different answer for that question as well.
What...was your answer, Yasu?...
I’m being told...that I shouldn’t say it...
That bad things will come if I say it...
How unfortunate. I suppose I will have to pass on this question as well.
Alright, hit me again! I’m starting to get fired up!
Earth to Sana! I said hit me again!
Oh! Sorry...I just...there's a page full of questions labeled “hard” and I was...looking at all of the answers myself.
Don’t just peer into my background like that. That's an invasion of privacy, isn't it?
S-Sorry! I’ve just...never really thought of...asking any of this stuff, and...and it’s...making me feel a little closer to you, since...you never tell me anything...
Then it’s a good thing you’re not the one up here! Leave those “hard” questions to Sensei’s self-proclaimed best friend, Rin Rokuhara. What’s next?
Uhh...okay, then...
Before Sensei was a teacher...he did something else...what was it?
Oh, I don’t think he’s told me this. But I remember Noriko saying something about it once and...
He was a...tutor wasn’t he? Or a babysitter or something?
He was a tutor. That is correct.
Sensei?
Yeah...they both got it right.
Though that’s essentially all I know about the subject matter.
Then...as a follow-up question...where did Sensei do that?...
Uhh...I don’t know. House calls? Coffee shops? Maybe he-
Heheh...
Huh? You don’t actually know, do you? Because you didn’t even know his age.
There are several answers to that question.
Two of which are very naughty.
But the one that’s likely written down is...
Well, I suppose it’s safe to just call it a storefront in the old district now.
Though, it was quite different back when it was used for...{i}educational{/i} purposes.
Uh...well, all it says here is “building in old district” so...I think Yasu gets a point for that.
Seriously? But that’s so vague...I didn’t realize we could just guess a district and say “Oh, it’s some building there.”
Umm...what do you think, Sensei?...Should we give Yasu a point? Or...
I don’t see why not. I can’t imagine she’ll be getting many more since half of her answers have been cut off by poor godly reception.
Ugh...fine. Whatever. Just give me the next question.
Okay...Here’s another “hard” one so...you can try to redeem yourself...
Rin...
What is the name...
Of Sensei’s mother?...
You have a mother?
Doesn’t...everyone have a mother?
I guess. I’ve just never heard him talk about her before.
In fact, the one time I tried asking about that, he-
Saki.
Huh?
His mother's name was Saki...
She didn’t like him very much.
uʍop ǝpᴉsdn s,ʇᴉ
